creator: tmantwch@pacbell.net
text:
Hello, we have an online ordering application on Win2K using SQL Server 2000, 
Apache 1.3.x, and Tomcat 3.3a (running as a service). About twice a day, the 
Tomcat service dies and has to be restarted. After a bit of digging, I've found 
that this message appears in the JVM.STDOUT file for each instance that Tomcat 
dies.

# 
# An EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION exception has been detected in native code 
outside the VM.
# Program counter=0x4116665b
#
EmbededTomcat: Init time 591
EmbededTomcat: Startup time 90


Any help you could give me would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!

creator: hgomez@slib.fr
text:
Which JVM are you using ? IBM, Sun ?
Are you using jni service from Tomcat ?

Could you try to launch Tomcat 3.3a from a .bat
file and tell us if the problem is still here ?

I am using Sun's jdk 1.3.1. I'm not using any jni service, and the problem 
occurs whether I run it from the bat file or as a service. 

Tomcat actually appears to die less often when run as a service rather than 
interactively, but I don't have any statistics yet to back up this observation.
creator: tmantwch@pacbell.net
william.barker@wilshire.com
text:
JVM crashes are outside of Tomcat.  It's likely that it's a bug in your JDBC 
driver, or, simply a bug in the JVM.
